description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a4oh2","text":"In this study, we present a comprehensive workflow to assess the coverage of publications in Social Science and Humanities (SSH) journals indexed in ERIH-PLUS and their Open Access status according to the Directory of Open Access Journals (DOAJ). The workflow utilizes three data sources: ERIH-PLUS, OpenCitations Meta, and DOAJ. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h5dn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ti93","text":"The application of this workflow results in a dataset containing detailed information on SSH publications, including their disciplines, countries of origin, and Open Access status. Each step of the methodology enriches the dataset with new variables and insights. The output of this workflow includes discipline and country rankings, as well as visualizations to effectively communicate the findings. By following this step-by-step approach, researchers can better understand the landscape of SSH publications, identify trends in disciplines and countries, and evaluate the prevalence of Open Access in the field.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqcoo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lmef","text":"The software implemented by means of this methodology and related documentation can be found in our github repository that will eventually be published on Zenodo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":17}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"43A31650E9D911ED9316D5554F6B60D4","url":"https://github.com/open-sci/2022-2023-playarists-code"}}}}

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.section: Retrieve OpenCitation Meta publication and Journals that are registered in ERIH-PLUS index
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ap3s8","text":"Starting from the ERIH-PLUS index of Social Science and Humanities approved journals dataset ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mv48","text":"  (downloaded 27/04/2023) we want to retrieve all the publications belonging to one of those journals, included in OpenCitations Meta database (https://opencitations.net/meta#:~:text=For%20each%20publication%2C%20the%20metadata,and%20PubMed%20Identifiers%20(PMIDs).)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":144,"length":121}],"data":{}},{"key":"dtd9d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"00D06150E9CC11EDA6CBE93A7346E3EA","id":368937,"original_name":"ERIHPLUSapprovedJournals.csv","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mijjb5d2x.csv"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"39423F67D63111EDB9470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://opencitations.net/meta#:~:text=For%20each%20publication%2C%20the%20metadata,and%20PubMed%20Identifiers%20(PMIDs)."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hgmf","text":"In order to fulfill this task, we download the OpenCitations Meta data dump. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duqim","text":"To process the files we run the file main.py : this script processes CSV files in parallel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":37,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rf6u","text":"This is how it works:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4tmf","text":"concurrent.futures.ProcessPoolExecutor","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":38}],"data":{}},{"key":"4uar","text":"This line creates a ProcessPoolExecutor with 4 worker processes. The with statement is used to ensure that the executor is properly closed once the processing is done. The number 4 represents the maximum number of worker processes that will be created to execute the tasks concurrently. You can adjust this number based on the resources available on your system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqr8g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vnjc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c1m9d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gsig","text":"The executor.map() function is used to apply the process_file_wrapper function to a list of input arguments. In this case, the input arguments are tuples, each containing a file from the batch_files and the erih_plus_df DataFrame. The executor.map() function returns an iterator that yields the results of applying the process_file_wrapper function to each tuple in the list.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1qj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b34b8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0mei","text":"This line extends the all_results list with the results obtained from processing the current batch of files. The extend() method is used to add multiple items to the list at once.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"alss6","text":"with concurrent.futures.ProcessPoolExecutor(max_workers=4) as executor:","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ue4o","text":"results = executor.map(process_file_wrapper, [(f, erih_plus_df) for f in batch_files])","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ckonn","text":"all_results.extend(results)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3kam","text":"1. To find the countries that have the highest number of publication we will sum the values in Publication_count column for every country.

2. This information will be saved in a dictionary that has the Country name as key and the total count of publication for each country as value.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do759","text":"3. To find the disciplines with the highest number of publication we will follow the same process but it will need to be done with both of the disciplines classifications.
